title: This Keyword Research Strategy DOUBLED My Sales on Amazon KDP

tactics.name: maturity_level_analysis
tactics.description: Assess book maturity by launch age, sales data, and review count to determine optimization timing
steps: Check current sales data and review count
Optimize ads, cover, and A+ content based on data
caveats: Requires 60 days of data for accurate analysis
source_quotes: Your book is at the worst stage in its publishing journey that it could possibly be.

tactics.name: review_maturity_optimization
tactics.description: Optimize book listings and pricing based on review count and sales data maturity
steps: Wait for 100 reviews before assessing maturity
source_quotes: Our book should have around 100 reviews. That's what I count as a mature book.

tactics.name: clickthrough_rate_optimization
tactics.description: Improve click-through rate via book cover optimization
steps: Optimize book cover using design principles
caveats: Requires design knowledge or data analysis
source_quotes: You have a higher clickthrough rate because you were able to optimize your book cover.

tactics.name: Indexing Power Strategy
tactics.description: Optimize for keywords your book is actually indexed for, rather than targeting broad keyword lists during launch
steps: Refine based on sales performance data
caveats: Requires 90-day maturity period for accurate data
source_quotes: If number three isn't indexed for your book, you will never ever ever show up for this keyword.

tactics.name: specific_keyword_launch
tactics.description: Launch with highly specific keywords to allow Amazon's algorithm to accurately categorize and expand reach organically
steps: Select 20 very specific, relevant keywords during launch
Let Amazon test and expand reach based on performing keywords
Wait for book to mature before scaling to broader keywords
caveats: Requires patience during initial launch phase
source_quotes: We want to select very, very, very specific keywords

heuristics.name: early_data_optimization
heuristics.condition: If median_reviews < 200 then boost optimization efforts
source_quotes: We now have 60 days of data... we can analyze and optimize

heuristics.name: review_based_pricing_strategy
heuristics.condition: If review count < 100, maintain low price
source_quotes: When it's at 100 reviews, we might be selling it at $16.99.

heuristics.name: Review-Driven Indexing
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize indexing power over broad keyword targeting
source_quotes: Your book is not going to rank number one in the first day... Amazon doesn't have any data to prove that your book is working

heuristics.name: review_based_boost
heuristics.condition: If median_reviews < 200 then boost specific keyword strategy
source_quotes: Anyone...knows it's much easier to sell a book with 100 reviews

claims.statement: New books have the lowest conversion potential due to lack of data
source_quotes: Your book is at the worst stage in its publishing journey that it could possibly be.

claims.statement: Books with 100+ reviews exhibit higher conversion rates
source_quotes: Now we have 100 reviews. Now we have 90 days worth of sales data. Now because our book is mature, we're going to have a higher conversion rate.

claims.statement: Amazon's algorithm indexes books based on keyword testing and sales performance
source_quotes: Amazon's going to pick a keyword... it will start indexing you for this

claims.statement: Books with higher review counts perform better in KDP sales
source_quotes: You're way more likely to sell...30 reviews

niche_patterns.description: Target specific niches with constrained demographics for higher conversion
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Narrower focus improves keyword relevance and review quality
source_quotes: We don't know the weaknesses of our book... we don't have any data
